result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Ann Kojis

records.addlTxt:
Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Michael T Crosby and Kelly Ann Kojis appear in custody via Zoom. Victim requests telephone contact with the defendant. Court allows defendant to have telephone contact with MK. All other conditions remain.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with MAK, BBK or their residence or place of employment.  Court allows only telephone contact with MAK. Defendant not to be within 1,000 feet of MAK or BBK addresses.  Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Michael T Crosby in court. Kelly Ann Kojis appears in custody via Zoom. Present bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kelly Ann Kojis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael T Crosby appeared by video for Kelly Ann Kojis.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Charles Greene in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Assistant District Attorney Joshua Dryak appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Kelly Ann Kojis in court.  Attorney Michael T Crosby in court for Kelly Ann Kojis. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Assistant District Attorney J. Foss Davis appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Michael T Crosby in court. Defendant Kelly Kojis appears in custody via Zoom. Defense requests GPS requirement removed from bond condition. State and victim do not object. Court orders GPS requirement removed. Court reminds defendant to contact CJS after release. All other conditions remain.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court removes electronic monitoring requirement. All other conditions remain.
